data.text: @AngryTheInch You are so lucky to be able to see it in front of you. While I only wish I could see it up close. You have a true blessing.

@AngryTheInch Yes - more than 10 years on and I still want to tell her things. Although now it’s good things I want to share - stories, foolishness, laughter. I also want to ask her practical things ..
@AngryTheInch So many moments like that one in my last 8 years, yes it will be like that, just your body will adjust a bit like to a lost part and somehow start learning to live with it…hug, Vesna

@AngryTheInch Spending a few hours wading thru some of Ma’s “treasures” in the cellar. A lot of muttering of “Oh Ma” as I open labeled boxes  only to find contents don’t match labels. Hope you’re feeling better soon Mia.

@AngryTheInch 💙 To me it is not happening any more. My father died 18 years ago. But I continue thinking what he would say about things that happen nowadays. And what he would suggest in difficult situations.

@AngryTheInch It will get easier but will still happen. Lost my mum 4 years and my dad 2, recently found voice messages on the phone from both of them and it broke me, can't delete them but I do listen to them occasionally now. Love and best wishes to you.
@AngryTheInch I wish you a fast recovery.
@AngryTheInch You still will your entire life. Hate March!  Both parents died in March. Miss them everyday!
@AngryTheInch Most likely, yes. Can relate. Hope you feel better soon.
@AngryTheInch Yes, it will. Nothing wrong with you talking to her all the same, whether or not you believe she is out there somewhere. Hug….
